titlepage.titleproper: A Guide to the TITLE, DATES
titlepage.subtitle:
A Collection in
Special Collections and Archives COLLECTION NUMBER
titlepage.author: FINDING AID AUTHOR

archdesc.runner: Special Collections and Archives, George Mason University

did.head: Descriptive Summary

repository.label: Repository
repository.corpname: George Mason University. Special Collections and Archives.

did.abstract: The collection contains issue files, legislative files, committee hearing files, thank-you letters, and constituent mail from his entire congressional career. There are also videotape cassettes, photographs, and many pieces of memorabilia. The collection will be closed to research until 2014.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Tom Davis papers, C0124, Special Collections and Archives, George Mason University Libraries.

bioghist.head: Biographical Information
bioghist.p: Elected in 1994, Davis began his career as chairman of the House Government Reform and Oversight Committee's Subcommittee on the District of Columbia. In January 2003, he was elected to chair the House Government Reform and Oversight Committee and was reappointed in January 2005 because of his outstanding work. He also served as the chairman of the National Republican Congressional Committee from 1998 to 2002. Davis retired from Congress in 2008.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: The collection contains issue files, legislative files, committee hearing files, thank-you letters, and constituent mail from his entire congressional career. There are also videotape cassettes, photographs, and many pieces of memorabilia.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Material
relatedmaterial.p: Special Collections and Archives also holds many other personal paper collections from local, state, and national politicians.

scopecontent.p: Final environmental assessment implementation of 2005 base realignment and closure (BRAC) recommendation 133 (Washington Headquarters Services) Fort Belvoir, Virginia. Tetra Tech, Inc. (includes CD with draft and final copy)

Bills introduced to Congress by the House Republicans.

scopecontent.p: Bills include: The Citizen Legislature Act, The Common Sense Legal Reform Act, The Fiscal Responsibility Act, The Senior Citizens' Equity Act, The National Security Act, The American Dream Restoration Act, The Family Reinforcement Act, The Personal Responsibility Act, The Taking Back Our Streets Act, The Job Creation and Wage Enhancement Act
